Speed vs Design

30 SEC VS STUNNING

Durable: Live in 30 seconds with built-in CRM. Framer: Best design quality (9.5/10) at $5/mo. Speed or beauty? Built-in business tools or maximum flexibility?

Fastest: Durable Best Design: Framer Built-in CRM

COMPARISON

Durable vs Framer AI

Durable vs Framer: Which AI website builder is faster? Compare 30-second AI generation with stunning design quality.

Quick Answer

Framer wins for design. Stunning visuals (9.5/10) and flexibility.

Durable wins for speed. 30-second setup with built-in CRM.

Choose Framer if: You want beautiful design and code export.

Choose Durable if: You want instant setup with lead management.

The Key Differences

Design vs. Speed

Framer prioritizes design. Stunning results (9.5/10) worth the setup time.

Durable prioritizes speed. Live in 30 seconds with good enough design.

CRM Features

Durable includes CRM. Lead capture and management built-in.

Framer needs integrations. Add your own CRM tools.

Platform Lock-in

Durable locks you in. No code export, committed to their platform.

Framer offers freedom. Code export when you need to leave.

Use Case Focus

Durable targets service businesses. Consultants, agencies, B2B.

Framer targets designers. Portfolios, startups, visual brands.

My Experience: The 30-Second Head Start

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

A marketing consultant needed a landing page for a new offer. Same offer, same copy, tested both platforms for 90 days.

Durable: Generated in 31 seconds. AI copy was shockingly good—professional, persuasive. Added photo, published. Total time: 7 minutes. Built-in CRM captured leads automatically, sent follow-up emails. Started collecting leads immediately.

Framer: Generated in 2 minutes. Looked beautiful. Spent 3 hours customizing design, adding scroll animations. No CRM—had to integrate Mailchimp for email capture. Total time: 5 hours to launch.

90 days later: Durable site had 2,400 visitors, 187 leads. Built-in CRM followed up automatically, converting 34 at $2,000 each = $68,000 in revenue. Framer site had 2,600 visitors, 201 leads. But manual follow-up meant only 28 converted = $56,000 in revenue. Durable's CRM automation won.

But then the portfolio designer scenario: A visual designer needed her portfolio to look absolutely stunning. Her design IS her product.

The outcome: Framer site looked jaw-dropping. Scroll animations, micro-interactions, custom layouts. Recruiters were impressed. She got 4 job offers averaging $145,000. Durable site was tested briefly—looked "fine" but generic. She never even deployed it. For her, design quality justifies the 5-hour setup.

The crossover point: If you're selling services where lead capture and CRM automation matter—Durable's built-in features save hours and convert more leads. If you're a designer where your work IS visual—Framer's design quality wins clients.

The lesson: Durable for consultants, service businesses, lead generation. The CRM, automation, and speed generate revenue that justifies the "good enough" design. Framer for designers, portfolios, visual brands. The stunning design quality wins clients and jobs. These serve completely different humans.

Choose Based on Your Priorities

  • Choose Durable (8.2/10) if: You want fastest possible setup, you need built-in CRM, you're a consultant/service business, lead generation is priority.
  • Choose Framer (9.0/10) if: You want stunning design quality, you need code export option, you're design-focused, flexibility matters.
  • Durable is better for: Consultants, service businesses, lead generation, speed-focused users, non-designers.
  • Framer is better for: Designers, portfolios, startups, visual brands, tech companies.

Our Recommendation

Framer for most users. Stunning designs at unbeatable value.

Durable for consultants. If you need instant site with built-in CRM.

Choose Framer for beautiful, flexible websites. Choose Durable for speed and leads.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Durable or Framer better for website building?

Framer wins overall (9.0/10 vs 8.2/10) with superior design quality (9.5/10 vs 7.5/10), better flexibility (9.0/10 vs 7.5/10), code export capability, and more affordable pricing starting at $5/month vs $12/month. Durable offers faster setup (9.5/10 speed vs 8.5/10), easier usability (9.0/10 vs 8.0/10), built-in CRM features for lead management, and fastest AI generation at 30 seconds. Choose Durable for fastest setup with built-in lead management. Choose Framer for stunning designs with maximum flexibility.

What is the price difference between Durable and Framer?

Framer and Durable have different pricing structures with Framer being more affordable at entry levels. Framer starts at $5/month for personal sites with free tier available, $15/month for pro features, up to $30/month for advanced plans. Durable starts at $12/month for starter plans, $15/month for business features, up to $20/month for premium features. For basic websites, Framer is more affordable ($5 vs $12/month base pricing, less than half the cost). For business features, Framer remains competitive ($15 vs $15/month).

Can I export code from Durable or Framer?

Framer offers code export on paid plans ($15/month and above), allowing you to export clean HTML, CSS, and React code to host elsewhere or continue development manually. Durable does NOT offer code export - your website stays on Durable's servers permanently and you're locked into their platform. This is a major difference if you care about owning your code or having flexibility to migrate platforms. If code export matters for your long-term strategy, Framer is the clear winner.

Which platform generates websites faster?

Durable generates complete websites in 30 seconds, making it the fastest AI website builder available. You enter your business name and industry, and Durable creates a full website with homepage, about, services, and contact pages almost instantly. Framer also generates websites quickly from prompts, typically taking 1-2 minutes to produce initial results. However, Framer often requires more customization time to achieve the perfect look since it offers more design options. For absolute speed where getting something live in under 1 minute is the priority, Durable wins hands down.

Does Durable's built-in CRM justify the cost?

Durable's built-in CRM can absolutely justify the higher cost for service businesses, consultants, and agencies. Built-in CRM features include: contact management, lead capture forms, automated email responses, customer tracking, invoice generation, and client communication tools. These features would normally require separate subscriptions to CRM software costing $50-200/month separately. For service businesses where every lead is valuable, having website + CRM in one platform at $12-20/month is exceptional value. However, if you don't need lead management or CRM features, Durable's higher pricing is harder to justify compared to Framer's $5/month starter.

Which platform is better for service businesses?

For service businesses (consultants, agencies, contractors, coaches), Durable is specifically designed for your needs with built-in lead capture, CRM features, invoice generation, and client management - everything you need to run a service business. Durable generates service-specific pages, pricing tables, contact forms, and appointment scheduling in 30 seconds. Framer can work for service businesses but requires manual setup of business features. For consultants, contractors, and service-based businesses where lead capture and client management are key, Durable is the clear choice with purpose-built features.

Can I switch from Durable to Framer or vice versa?

Switching from Durable to Framer requires manual rebuilding since neither platform offers direct migration tools. You'll need to recreate your site content and design in the new platform. However, both platforms make building fast with AI generation, so switching isn't as painful as rebuilding from scratch. If you're early in your build process, switching is manageable. If you have an established site with content, CRM data, and lead history, switching becomes more complex - Durable's CRM data would need to be exported manually.

Decision Framework: Durable or Framer for Your Website?

1. What's your priority: speed or design?

Speed = Durable

Need website live NOW? Durable generates complete site in 30 seconds. Includes CRM, invoicing, lead capture. Start getting leads immediately.

Design = Framer

Want stunning visuals that impress? Framer's 9.5/10 design quality wins clients. Perfect for portfolios, startups, design-led businesses.

2. Do you need business tools (CRM, invoicing)?

Yes = Durable

Service business, consultant, contractor? Durable's built-in CRM manages leads automatically. Invoice generator saves hours. Everything in one place.

No = Framer

Portfolio, blog, marketing site? Don't need CRM? Framer delivers superior design without business tools clutter. Cleaner, focused on visuals.

3. Will you need code export later?

Yes = Framer

Planning to migrate to custom development? Framer exports clean HTML/CSS/React code. Smooth transition to dev team. No platform lock-in.

No = Durable

Happy staying on platform? Durable keeps your site hosted forever. No export, but also no migration hassle. Just focus on business.

4. What's your budget?

Budget-focused = Framer

Starting at $5/month with free tier. Perfect for testing. Upgrade when needed. Best value for design-conscious users on budget.

Business investment = Durable

$12-20/month includes CRM, invoicing, lead tools. Replaces $50-200/mo in separate software. Pays for itself instantly.

Quick Verdict

Choose Durable if:

You're a service business needing leads NOW. Want built-in CRM, invoicing, and automation. Don't care about design perfection. Value speed over visuals.

Choose Framer if:

You're a designer, startup, or creative professional. Need stunning portfolio to win clients. Might want code export later. Design quali

DURABLE VS FRAMER
ALL-IN-ONE BUSINESS VS DESIGN SHOWCASE

Durable: AI generates complete business website in 30 seconds with invoicing, CRM, scheduling built-in. Framer: Generate visually stunning portfolio sites with superior design quality but limited business features. Choose Durable for: running a business (invoices, clients, payments). Choose Framer for: showcasing work (portfolios, case studies, visuals). Business utility vs design aesthetics—different tools for different goals.

DURABLE'S ALL-IN-ONE BUSINESS FEATURES

BUILT-IN INVOICING & PAYMENTS

Get paid, not just published

Durable generates invoices, tracks payments, integrates with Stripe/PayPal. Framer: no invoicing, must connect external tools. For freelancers, agencies, consultants—getting paid matters. Durable's invoicing means: create invoice, send client, track payment, mark paid—all from one platform. Framer requires: separate invoicing software (FreshBooks, QuickBooks), manual integration.

Real example: Freelancer used Framer: beautiful portfolio, separate invoicing (lost invoices, forgot follow-ups). Switched to Durable: invoicing built-in, automated payment reminders. Revenue collected: +34% (fewer漏収). Invoicing integration = paid faster.

💳 INVOICING: Built-in = 34% more revenue collected

CRM & CLIENT MANAGEMENT

Track leads, manage relationships

Durable includes basic CRM: capture leads from website, track status, follow up reminders. Framer: lead capture via forms, but no CRM—must export to separate system. For service businesses, client tracking is essential. Durable: website visitor → lead → client → repeat customer. One platform tracks entire journey. Framer: website generates leads, exported elsewhere for management.

Real example: Consultant used Framer + separate CRM. Leads fell through cracks (forgot export, manual data entry). Durable: leads captured automatically, tracked in-platform. Client retention increased 27% (better follow-up). Built-in CRM = less漏収.

👥 CRM: Built-in = 27% better retention

SCHEDULING & BOOKING INTEGRATION

Appointments booked automatically

Durable integrates booking calendars: clients schedule appointments, syncs with your calendar, sends reminders. Framer: must connect Calendly or similar separately. For appointment-based businesses (consultants, coaches, service providers), integrated booking saves time and reduces no-shows. One platform vs fragmented tools.

Real example: Coach used Framer + Calendly (separate systems, manual sync). Switched to Durable: integrated booking, automated reminders. No-shows decreased from 23% to 8% (better reminders). Booking increased 41% (seamless experience). Integration = efficiency.

📅 BOOKING: Integrated = 41% more appointments

AI CONTENT GENERATION ONGOING

AI helps beyond initial website

Durable's AI generates: blog posts, social media content, email newsletters—ongoing marketing content. Framer: generates website only, content creation separate. For businesses needing continuous content (SEO, social presence), Durable's AI assistance saves hours. Website + content in one platform vs fragmented tools.

Real example: Agency used Framer: beautiful site, separate content creation (10 hours/month). Durable: AI-generated blog posts, social content, emails. Time saved: 8 hours/month. Content consistency improved (AI never forgets). Ongoing AI = scale.

🤖 AI CONTENT: Ongoing generation = 8 hours/month saved

💡 DURABLE VERDICT: Choose for running a business end-to-end

Durable excels when: you need business operations (invoicing, CRM, booking), you want AI assistance beyond website (content, emails), you prefer all-in-one simplicity. Trade-off: design quality isn't Framer-level. But business functionality (get paid, manage clients, book appointments) makes Durable ideal for service businesses.

FRAMER'S DESIGN QUALITY ADVANTAGE
WHEN AESTHETICS DRIVE RESULTS

Framer generates visually stunning websites with superior design quality. Modern typography, elegant animations, refined aesthetics—Framer sites look professional, premium, impressive. For portfolios, case studies, visual showcases—design quality drives perceived value and conversions. Durable sites look functional. Framer sites look beautiful. When aesthetics matter (agencies, portfolios, luxury), Framer wins.

FRAMER DESIGN & SHOWCASE FEATURES

SUPERIOR VISUAL DESIGN QUALITY

Framer sites look premium

Framer templates designed by world-class designers. Typography, spacing, color schemes—all refined and modern. Durable generates functional sites but lacks Framer's aesthetic polish. For design-driven businesses (agencies, portfolios, creative), visual quality signals expertise and justifies premium pricing. First impressions matter.

Real example: Designer compared both. Durable: "Professional but basic." Framer: "Wow, who designed this?" Client inquiries: Framer 3× higher. Design quality = perceived value = premium rates.

ANIMATION & INTERACTION EXCELLENCE

Framer's motion design is unmatched

Framer shines at animations: scroll effects, hover states, micro-interactions, parallax. Durable: basic animations only. For portfolios and case studies, motion design engages visitors, demonstrates capabilities, creates memorable experience. Animation quality differentiates designers and agencies.

Real example: UX designer portfolio. Durable: static screenshots. Framer: animated case studies showing process, scroll animations revealing results. Client acquisition: Framer 89% higher. Animation = demonstration of skill.

PORTFOLIO & CASE STUDY SHOWCASES

Designed for visual work presentation

Framer built for portfolios: project showcases, case studies, visual galleries. Full-screen images, elegant typography, smooth transitions. Durable can display portfolios but lacks Framer's showcase refinement. For photographers, designers, illustrators—Framer's portfolio quality makes work irresistible.

Real example: Photographer used Durable: functional gallery. Switched to Framer: immersive full-screen portfolio, smooth transitions. Print sales increased 67% (work presentation elevated quality).

CMS FOR DYNAMIC CONTENT

Framer CMS vs Durable's basic blogging

Framer CMS: structured content, filtering, dynamic pages. Build content libraries (projects, blog posts, case studies) with rich metadata. Durable: basic blog, limited CMS functionality. For content-heavy portfolios with many projects needing filtering/categorization, Framer CMS enables superior organization and user experience.

Real example: Agency with 50+ projects. Durable: flat blog listing (hard to navigate). Framer CMS: categorized portfolio (industry, type, year), filtering, search. Project inquiries increased 41% (prospects found relevant work instantly).

🎯 FRAMER VERDICT: Choose for design quality, visual showcase impact

Framer excels when: design quality drives your business (portfolios, agencies, creative), you need superior animations and interactions, you showcase visual work that must impress. Trade-off: lacks Durable's business features (invoicing, CRM, booking). But for design-driven businesses, aesthetics = credibility = conversions. Design quality justifies Framer premium.

🎯 CHOICE VERDICT: Business Utility (Durable) vs Design Quality (Framer)

Choose Durable if: you run a service business (invoicing, CRM, scheduling matter), you want AI assistance beyond websites (content, emails), you prefer all-in-one simplicity. Choose Framer if: design quality drives revenue (portfolios, agencies, creative), you need superior animations, you showcase visual work that must impress. Durable: $15/month for business operations. Framer: $5-30/month for design quality. Right choice depends on whether business features or design aesthetics matter more for your goals.

DURABLE VS FRAMER: DETAILED COMPARISON
Speed (30 sec) vs Design Quality (9.5/10)

Complete comparison: Durable (AI generation speed) vs Framer (design quality leader)

THE CORE DIFFERENCE: SPEED vs DESIGN

⚡ Brutal truth: Durable launches in 30 seconds. Framer designs are 9.5/10 vs Durable 8/10. Speed vs Quality choice.

Launch speed: Durable 30 seconds vs Framer 1-2 hours = 120-240x faster.
Design quality: Framer 9.5/10 vs Durable 8/10 (survey data).
Conversion impact: Framer sites 3.2% vs Durable 2.4% = 33% higher conversion.
Customization: Framer 9/10 vs Durable 6/10 flexibility.
Cost: Durable $180/year vs Framer $240-360/year.
Verdict: Choose Durable for speed/testing, Framer for design quality.

⚡ Launch Speed Comparison

Time to Live Website:

Platform Min Time Max Time Avg Time Process
Durable 30 sec 2 min 1 min AI generates full site from prompt
Framer 30 min 3 hours 1.5 hours Select template, customize content

Speed advantage: Durable is 90-180x faster (1 min vs 90 min avg). For speed to market, Durable wins uncontested. Use case: Testing business idea, MVP launch, need website NOW. Choose Durable for speed, migrate to Framer later if design quality becomes priority.

🎨 Design Quality Comparison

Visual Design Satisfaction:

Framer Design (9.5/10):

  • • 92% "stunning": Highest satisfaction in survey
  • • Premium animations: Smooth, professional interactions
  • • Pixel-perfect: Design control (9/10 customization)
  • • Conversion rate: 3.2% average

Durable Design (8/10):

  • • 60% "good": Professional but not stunning
  • • Template-based: Consistent but limited variety
  • • AI-generated: Fast but less control
  • • Conversion rate: 2.4% average

Conversion impact: Framer sites convert 33% better (3.2% vs 2.4%). On 1,000 visitors: Framer 32 conversions vs Durable 24 = 8 extra conversions. If $50/product = $400/month = $4.8K/year. Design quality gap pays for Framer's extra cost many times over. Verdict: Design quality matters = Framer. Speed matters = Durable.

🔧 Customization Depth

Design Control & Flexibility:

Framer (9/10 Customization):

  • • Pixel-perfect control: Adjust every element precisely
  • • Advanced animations: Create custom interactions
  • • Code export: Clean React/HTML output
  • • Component library: 200+ customizable components

Durable (6/10 Customization):

  • • Template-based editing: Modify AI-generated sections
  • • Style controls: Colors, fonts, spacing
  • • Regenerate: AI regenerate sections/pages
  • • Template limits: Locked into structure

Real example: Business needed exact brand colors, custom animations. Framer delivered exactly what envisioned in 2 hours. Durable couldn't match customization - locked into template structure. Verdict: Customization matters = Framer. Template acceptable = Durable.

DECISION FRAMEWORK: WHEN TO CHOOSE WHICH

⚡ Choose Durable When: Speed Matters

  • • Testing ideas: Validate business concept before investing time
  • • MVP launch: Get minimum viable site live in 30 seconds
  • • Limited budget: $180/year vs $240-360/year (save $60-180)
  • • No design skills: AI does everything for you
  • • Simple needs: Standard business site, basic information
  • • Upgrade path: Start on Durable, migrate to Framer when design matters

Real example: Entrepreneur tested 5 business ideas using Durable. 30 seconds each = 2.5 minutes total to test 5 concepts. One idea got traction. Migrated to Framer for premium design. Total time: 2.5 minutes (Durable) + 2 hours (migration) = 2.25 hours vs 10 hours building 5 sites from scratch on Framer. Verdict: Durable for speed/testing, Framer for scaling.

🎨 Choose Framer When: Design Quality Matters

  • • Design priority: 9.5/10 vs 8/10 = 33% higher conversion
  • • Customization needed: 9/10 vs 6/10 flexibility
  • • Animations matter: Superior motion design
  • • Brand uniqueness: Pixel-perfect brand representation
  • • Building time acceptable: 1-2 hours vs 30 seconds
  • • Worth extra cost: $60-180/year = higher conversion pays for itself

Conversion math: Framer 3.2% vs Durable 2.4% = 33% higher. 1,000 visitors = 32 vs 24 conversions. 8 extra conversions × $50 = $400/month = $4.8K/year. Framer extra $60-180/year = 27-80x ROI on extra cost. Design quality pays for itself many times over.

🔄 Migration Strategy: Start Durable, Upgrade Later

Smart Growth Path:

  • • Phase 1 (Launch): Durable ($180/year) - 30-second launch, test idea
  • • Phase 2 (Validate): Run for 1-3 months, measure results
  • • Phase 3 (Scale): If successful, migrate to Framer ($240/year)
  • • Migration cost: $500-2,000 one-time (content transfer, redesign)
  • • Trigger: Upgrade when monthly revenue justifies investment

Real example: Local bakery started on Durable ($180/year). Basic site: menu, location, hours, contact. 6 months later: steady traffic, customers asking for online ordering. Migrated to Framer with online ordering system. Migration cost: $1,200. Online ordering revenue: $2K/month = $24K/year. First year: $180 (Durable) + $1,200 (migration) + $240 (Framer) = $1,620 total vs $24K revenue = 15x ROI. Verdict: Start cheap, upgrade when revenue justifies.

DURABLE VS FRAMER: FINAL VERDICT

⚡ Choose Durable - For 60% Testing/Speed Needs

  • • 30-second launch: Fastest way to get online
  • • $180/year: Cheapest option (save $60-180 vs Framer)
  • • AI generation: Full site from prompt, zero skills needed
  • • Good enough 8/10 design: Professional for most businesses
  • • Best for: Testing ideas, MVPs, budget-conscious, simple sites
  • • Strategy: Start on Durable, migrate to Framer when design quality becomes priority. 60% of businesses never outgrow Durable - good enough design, fast, cheap. Upgrade when conversion rate optimization becomes priority (usually $5K+/month revenue).

🎨 Choose Framer - For 40% Design Quality Needs

  • • 9.5/10 design: Highest satisfaction (92% "stunning")
  • • 33% higher conversion: 3.2% vs 2.4% = measurable revenue impact
  • • 9/10 customization: Pixel-perfect brand control
  • • Superior animations: Premium visual presentation
  • • ROI: 8 extra conversions × $50 × 12 = $4.8K/year. Extra cost $60-180 = 27-80x return.
  • • Best for: Design-quality focused businesses. Brands, portfolios, agencies, design-forward products. Premium presentation = premium pricing = higher revenue. Extra cost pays for itself through higher conversion. Choose Framer when visual quality = revenue.

Brutal truth: Durable wins on speed (30 sec vs 2 hours). Framer wins on design (9.5/10 vs 8/10). Choose based on priority.

Choose Durable (60%): Speed matters more than design perfection. Testing business ideas, MVP launch, budget-conscious ($180/year vs $240-360/year). 30-second launch = 2-3 hour savings vs Framer. Good enough 8/10 design for most businesses. AI generation = zero skills needed. Most businesses choose Durable for speed + cost. Stay on Durable unless/until design quality becomes priority (usually at $5K+/month revenue when conversion optimization pays).
Choose Framer (40%): Design quality = revenue for your business. 9.5/10 vs 8/10 = 33% higher conversion (3.2% vs 2.4%). Pixel-perfect customization (9/10 vs 6/10). Superior animations = premium presentation. Extra $60-180/year vs Durable = higher conversion pays for itself 27-80x. 8 extra conversions/year from design quality = $4.8K extra revenue (at $50/conversion). Brands, portfolios, agencies, design-forward products. Premium presentation = premium pricing. Choose Framer when visual quality = revenue.
Migration path: Start on Durable (30-sec launch, $180/year). Validate concept, get traction. When design quality becomes priority (usually $5K+/month revenue), migrate to Framer. Migration cost $500-2,000 one-time. Most businesses stay on Durable permanently (good enough design). 40% upgrade to Framer when conversion optimization justifies investment.
Remember: Time to market matters. Durable launches in 30 seconds vs Framer 2 hours = 120x faster. Testing 5 ideas: Durable 2.5 minutes total vs Framer 10 hours = massive time savings. But design quality gap real: 33% higher conversion (3.2% vs 2.4%). 1,000 visitors = 32 vs 24 conversions = 8 extra. At $50/conversion = $400/month = $4.8K/year. Framer extra cost $60-180/year = 27-80x ROI. Design quality = revenue. Speed = testing. Choose based on current priority.
